key_points: Police have been called to the Duke and Duchess of Sussex’s mansion in southern California nine times in the past nine months.
The calls included phone requests, alarm activations, and property crimes.
In July, there were four calls to police: a phone request and several alarm activations.
A trespassing incident occurred on Christmas Eve, resulting in Nickolas Brooks being charged.
The most recent police call was an alarm activation at 2.21am on February 16.
Representatives of the Sussexes and the sheriff’s department have not commented on the incidents.
The couple's security became a public concern after their interview with Oprah Winfrey.
Meghan pleaded with Harry's family not to remove his personal protection due to death threats.
Harry was surprised to lose his UK taxpayer-funded security after stepping back from royal duties.
The Sussexes have privately funded their security arrangements in the US.
